articles.headline: Why Fund Managers May Be Right About the Fed
articles.snippet: What hedge fund investors are expressing should trouble all of us: they have almost no confidence in the Federal Reserve or the economics profession.
articles.abstract: What hedge fund investors are expressing should trouble all of us: they have almost no confidence in the Federal Reserve or the economics profession.
articles.lead_paragraph: The economics world has been having a lot of fun with hedge fund managers.

articles.headline: I.R.S. Chief Out After Protest Over Scrutiny of Groups
articles.snippet: The Obama administration stepped up pressure on the Internal Revenue Service and sought to insulate itself from the outcry over the agency’s special scrutiny of conservative groups.
articles.abstract: The Obama administration stepped up pressure on the Internal Revenue Service and sought to insulate itself from the outcry over the agency’s special scrutiny of conservative groups.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama announced Wednesday night that the acting commissioner of the Internal Revenue Service had been ousted after disclosures that the agency gave special scrutiny to conservative groups. Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr., meanwhile, warned top I.R.S. officials that a Justice Department inquiry would examine any false statements to see if they constituted a crime.

articles.headline: Big Banks Get Break in Rules to Limit Risks
articles.snippet: Lobbyists for the nation’s biggest banks have persuaded federal regulators to soften a proposed Dodd-Frank rule, a move that is expected to protect Wall Street’s control over the $700 trillion derivatives market.
articles.abstract: Lobbyists for the nation’s biggest banks have persuaded federal regulators to soften a proposed Dodd-Frank rule, a move that is expected to protect Wall Street’s control over the $700 trillion derivatives market.

articles.headline: After Bangladesh, Seeking New Sources
articles.snippet: A search for new locations has taken on greater urgency for Western retailers, whose complex manufacturing needs already shrink the pool of potential locations.
articles.abstract: A search for new locations has taken on greater urgency for Western retailers, whose complex manufacturing needs already shrink the pool of potential locations.
articles.lead_paragraph: SEMARANG, Indonesia — Bennett Model helped pioneer the exporting of garments from China in 1975, the year before Mao Zedong died, and ever since, his New York fashion company has searched for other countries, from Guatemala to Vietnam to Indonesia, capable of supplying top retailers like Bergdorf Goodman and Neiman Marcus.

articles.headline: Shareholders Denied Access to JPMorgan Vote Results
articles.snippet: In the midst of a vote on whether to split the roles of chairman and chief executive at JPMorgan Chase, the firm providing tabulations stopped giving snapshots to the proposal’s sponsors.
articles.abstract: In the midst of a vote on whether to split the roles of chairman and chief executive at JPMorgan Chase, the firm providing tabulations stopped giving snapshots to the proposal’s sponsors.
articles.lead_paragraph: When it comes to shareholder votes, the running tallies are a closely guarded secret. Only a handful of parties get a peek into how these corporate battles are shaping up.
articles.byline: By Susanne Craig and Jessica Silver-Greenberg

articles.headline: Mandela Fades Amid Battles Over Who Will Claim Legacy
articles.snippet: As Nelson Mandela, 94, grows more fragile, the struggle in South Africa over how he will be remembered, and what he has to pass on, has become increasingly acrimonious.
articles.abstract: As Nelson Mandela, 94, grows more fragile, the struggle in South Africa over how he will be remembered, and what he has to pass on, has become increasingly acrimonious.
articles.lead_paragraph: JOHANNESBURG — “Smile!” the visitor implored, an edge of forced bonhomie in his voice, as he held up a cellphone camera to take a snapshot.

articles.headline: Baffling Rise in Suicides Plagues the U.S. Military
articles.snippet: Of the crises facing American troops today, suicide ranks among the most emotionally wrenching — and confounding.
articles.abstract: Of the crises facing American troops today, suicide ranks among the most emotionally wrenching — and confounding.
articles.lead_paragraph: After Specialist Freddy Hook, a medic with the Army’s 82nd Airborne Division, killed himself in 2010, the trail of possible causes seemed long.
articles.byline: By James Dao and Andrew W. Lehren

articles.headline: Google Escalates the Competition in Map Services
articles.snippet: The new service creates real-time, personalized maps and incorporates 3-dimensional images from inside businesses and from Google Earth.
articles.abstract: The new service creates real-time, personalized maps and incorporates 3-dimensional images from inside businesses and from Google Earth.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Cartographers, beware: the map wars have begun.

articles.headline: Onset of Woes Casts Pall Over Obama’s Policy Aspirations
articles.snippet: The Obama administration controversies of recent days have reinforced fears of an overreaching government and called into question Mr. Obama’s ability to master his own presidency.
articles.abstract: The Obama administration controversies of recent days have reinforced fears of an overreaching government and called into question Mr. Obama’s ability to master his own presidency.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Thwarted on Capitol Hill, stymied in the Middle East and now beset by scandal, President Obama has reached a point just six months after a heady re-election where the second term he had hoped for has collided with the second term he actually has.

articles.headline: How Elliott and Hess Settled a Bitter Proxy Battle
articles.snippet: Hess gave the activist hedge fund Elliott Management three board seats in exchange for the fund’s support of the company’s slate of five directors.
articles.abstract: Hess gave the activist hedge fund Elliott Management three board seats in exchange for the fund’s support of the company’s slate of five directors.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced
